message_1: What is the quadratic residue of 19 mod 23?
message_2:
A quadratic residue is a number that is congruent to a perfect square modulo a given modulus. In this case, we want to find the quadratic residue of 19 modulo 23.

To find the quadratic residue, we need to find an integer x such that x^2 ≡ 19 (mod 23). We can do this by testing the squares of integers from 1 to 22 (mod 23) and checking if any of them are congruent to 19.

1^2 ≡ 1 (mod 23)
2^2 ≡ 4 (mod 23)
3^2 ≡ 9 (mod 23)
4^2 ≡ 16 (mod 23)
5^2 ≡ 2 (mod 23)
6^2 ≡ 13 (mod 23)
7^2 ≡ 3 (mod 23)
8^2 ≡ 18 (mod 23)
9^2 ≡ 12 (mod 23)
10^2 ≡ 8 (mod 23)
11^2 ≡ 6 (mod 23)
12^2 ≡ 9 (mod 23)
13^2 ≡ 16 (mod 23)
14^2 ≡ 4 (mod 23)
15^2 ≡ 1 (mod 23)
16^2 ≡ 18 (mod 23)
17^2 ≡ 3 (mod 23)
18^2 ≡ 13 (mod 23)
19^2 ≡ 2 (mod 23)
20^2 ≡ 12 (mod 23)
21^2 ≡ 8 (mod 23)
22^2 ≡ 6 (mod 23)

None of the squares of integers from 1 to 22 (mod 23) are congruent to 19. Therefore, 19 is not a quadratic residue modulo 23.
